author: EP
title: Boeing va a la huelga por primera vez en 16 años
text: Secciones Servicios Destacamos EP Viernes, 13 de septiembre 2024, 11:46 Necesitas ser suscriptor para acceder a esta funcionalidad. Opciones para compartir El sindicato de los trabajadores de Boeing en en la región de Seattle (EE.UU.) ha convocado una huelga por primera vez en 16 años y ha rechazado la oferta del fabricante para subir un 25% los salarios. Según recoge DPA, el 94,65% de los trabajadores votaron que no a la oferta que lanzó Boeing para evitar los paros, que contemplaba una subida salarial del 25% en cuatro años, mejorar en las coberturas sanitarias y las jubilaciones, dado que el sindicato IAM había pedido inicialmente un incremento del 40% en los salarios. Además, el 96% apoyó la convocatoria de huelga. La huelga ha comenzado a las 00.00 hora local de este viernes para unos 30.000 trabajadores. Los representantes sindicales han señalado en una rueda de prensa recogida por 'Bloomberg' que los puntos del acuerdo no eran lo suficientemente buenos y que la oferta no compensaba los 16 años de estancamiento salarial, el aumento de los gastos sanitarios y la deslocalización de miles de empleos sindicales. Por su parte, Boeing ha emitido un comunicado en el que muestra su compromiso para restablecer la relación con los trabajadores y el sindicato, además de volver a la mesa para alcanzar un nuevo acuerdo. Boeing atraviesa una crisis de reputación, de seguridad y económica desde 2019, cuando dos aviones 737 MAX sufrieron accidentes fatales. Tras esto, se han producido otros incidentes, como la caída de una parte del fuselaje de un avión de Alaska Airlines a principios de este año. Publicidad Publicidad Te puede interesar La última comida de sor Clara: «Gracias por todo» El Diario Montañés Publicidad Publicidad Comentar es una ventaja exclusiva para suscriptores ¿Ya eres suscriptor? Necesitas ser suscriptor para poder votar. Reporta un error en esta noticia

author: Reporter
title: ALERT: Weather warning for Mayo this weekend
text:
A Status Yellow snow and ice warning has been issued for the whole of Connacht, as well as Leinster, Cavan, Donegal, Monaghan, Clare, Limerick, Tipperary and Waterford from 5pm tomorrow until 5pm on Sunday.
Falls of sleet and snow with snowfall accumulations can be expected, which could lead to travel disruption.
Speaking on RTÉ's Morning Ireland, Met Éireann senior forecaster Gerry Murphy said the cold weather will continue today with another frosty night in store and temperatures are expected to reach as low as -4C.

author: Comunicação Sicos
title: Santa Catarina tem mais de 9 mil vagas de emprego abertas pelo Sine  - SICOS
text:
Santa Catarina tem mais de 9 mil vagas de emprego abertas pelo Sine
As regiões com maior número de oportunidades são Grande Florianópolis (2.285 vagas), Vale do Itajaí (2.056) e o Sul (1.610) – Foto: Ricardo Wolffenbüttel/Arquivo/Secom
O Sistema Nacional de Emprego (Sine) de Santa Catarina está com 9.021 vagas de emprego abertas nesta semana, sendo 279 destinadas a pessoas com deficiência (PcD). As três regiões com maior número de oportunidades são Grande Florianópolis (2.285 vagas), Vale do Itajaí (2.056) e o Sul do estado (1.610).
A diversidade de setores e funções é ampla, contemplando desde vagas na indústria e construção civil até comércio, logística e serviços. As cidades com maior destaque são São José, com 1.122 vagas, Tubarão, com 447 oportunidades, e Chapecó, com 369.
Para o secretário de Indústria, Comércio e Serviço (Sicos), Silvio Dreveck, os dados refletem a força do mercado de trabalho catarinense e o empenho do Governo do Estado em manter Santa Catarina entre os líderes nacionais em empregabilidade.
“Temos trabalhado fortemente com políticas públicas integradas para estimular a geração de empregos em todas as regiões. O Sine é uma ferramenta essencial nesse processo, conectando trabalhadores às empresas e fortalecendo a economia catarinense. O objetivo é manter Santa Catarina como um dos estados que mais emprega no Brasil”, destacou Dreveck.
As vagas são atualizadas semanalmente e os interessados podem se cadastrar diretamente nas unidades do Sine em todo o Estado ou pelo portal Emprega Brasil.
Confira a distribuição completa das vagas por região:

author: AFP
title: Guerre Israël-Hamas : Emmanuel Macron inquiet pour les catholiques de Gaza - La Voix du Nord
text: Guerre Israël-Hamas : Emmanuel Macron inquiet pour les catholiques de Gaza Emmanuel Macron a exprimé au patriarche latin de Jérusalem « sa vive préoccupation » face à « la situation dramatique » de la paroisse catholique de [Gaza](https://www.lavoixdunord.fr/1412501/article/2023-12-24/gaza-neuf-soldats-israeliens-tues-samedi-tsahal-veut-maintenant-frapper-khan) où deux paroissiennes ont été tuées « de manière indigne » le 16 décembre par un soldat israélien, a indiqué dimanche l’Élysée. À l’occasion d’un entretien téléphonique samedi à l’avant-veille de Noël avec le cardinal Pierbattista Pizzaballa, le président français a évoqué « la situation dramatique de la paroisse latine de Gaza », où « des centaines de civils de toutes confessions (…) [vivent sous les bombes et les balles](https://www.lavoixdunord.fr/1411785/article/2023-12-22/deja-sous-les-bombes-d-israel-gaza-vit-maintenant-la-famine) depuis plus de deux mois tandis que les fidèles et les sœurs y prennent soin de personnes malades, âgées ou handicapées ». Tuées sur le parvis d’une église Il a fait part de ses condoléances « pour la mort de deux paroissiennes, tuées de manière indigne il y a quelques jours ». Le 16 décembre, une mère et sa fille, toutes deux chrétiennes, ont été tuées par un [soldat israélien](https://www.lavoixdunord.fr/1408122/article/2023-12-13/bombardements-gaza-israel-face-aux-pressions-de-ses-allies-dans-sa-guerre-contre) sur le parvis de la seule église catholique de Gaza. Le pape François a dénoncé le lendemain la mort de ces deux femmes. Dans la perspective de la [ messe de Noël](https://www.lavoixdunord.fr/1412212/article/2023-12-23/messes-de-minuit-ou-vivre-la-tradition), en l’église de la Nativité à Bethléem, Emmanuel Macron a demandé au patriarche latin « d’adresser un message de paix et de solidarité à tous les Chrétiens de Terre Sainte, et de les assurer que la France se tient à leurs côtés ». Solidarité Le président a réaffirmé « la fidélité de la France à ses engagements, et notamment au rôle particulier [de protection ](https://www.lavoixdunord.fr/1399793/article/2023-11-22/un-chirurgien-lillois-gaza-la-derniere-bombe-moins-d-un-kilometre-de-l-hopital)d’un certain nombre de communautés chrétiennes, exercé à travers le consulat général de France à Jérusalem ». « Cette responsabilité, héritée de l’histoire, sera pleinement assumée face aux risques contemporains qui pèsent sur ces communautés », a assuré Emmanuel Macron, qui a envoyé parallèlement un message de « soutien » et de « solidarité » aux communautés chrétiennes, via le consulat de France à Jérusalem.

author: DrMagical Contributor
title: Long delay from installation to digital voice reactivated
text:
I have just migrated from FTTC to FTTP, engineer came yesterday and connected me. The 'landline' was working fine but now dead.
I have rung BT who say that digital voice will be reactivated when the order is complete on 27th January - 18 days time.
Why so long? It seems off to me to leave me without a phone line when all it needs is an activation?
Also not getting the speeds I have paid for - paid for 900 package - BT test for speed to the hub varies from 500-600. Stay fast guarantee promise for me on signing up was 700.
Rang BT and they said broadband won't be fully functional until the order is complete on 27th January!
Just wanted to ask does this sound right?
Thanks!!!
Thanks - will do!
Have you plugged the phone into the green phone socket on the rear of the Smarthub?
Have you logged onto your Smarthub2 http://bthomehub.home/home.htm management page to see if the phone is showing there and what status it is showing?
As regards the poor speeds, you should be getting the full speed from day one that it went live. You will be expected to pay from that date!
Call BT and tell them that you have a problem and do not be fobbed off.
Yes phone plugged in and status in hub settings says ‘not configured’ and I cannot click on it. Tried a few phones that were working until the switchover yesterday.

author: College News
title: 21 recruits take the oath at SEALETA graduation
text:
Cochise College held its law enforcement recognition ceremony on Thursday, December 5, at the college’s Sierra Vista Campus celebrating the graduation of 21 Southeast Arizona Law Enforcement Training Academy (SEALETA) officers.
 Dr. J.D. Rottweiler, college president, extended his congratulatory remarks to all the recruits and expressed his thanks, especially to the families and friends for the support they have given to their students. Then he addressed the new officers and said, “You made it!” Dr. Rottweiler encouraged them to get involved in the community and continue their journey as lifelong learners. Upon graduation, the officers not only earned their badges but also received 30 college credits.
Sheriff Mark Dannels led the recognition ceremony serving as the master of ceremonies. Sierra Vista Police Department Chief Chris Hiser delivered opening remarks. Honorable Judge James Conlogue administered the Oath of a Peace Officer, a solemn pledge symbolizing the recruits’ dedication to upholding justice and protecting the community.
With their class motto “No Sacrifice Too Great, Duty First” as a theme throughout their training, the graduating recruits were filled with excitement and pride. Four recruits were recognized for special class awards among the program graduates. Luis Morales received the physical fitness award and set the highest SEALETA record of 652. The minimum passing score is 384. Rafael Gonzalez Valdez was awarded the academic award for achieving 99.18% overall setting a new SEALETA record. Jared Ratkovich received the firearms award, shooting 200 out of 200 in the daytime and 190 at night. Brandon Leach received the unofficial tactical driving award.
Joshua Darpino, the class leader expressed gratitude to all the instructors for sharing their time, knowledge and expertise. “Today, we can proudly say we worked as a team. Thank you for your mentorship. Over the past weeks, each of us has grown and improved to become a better person in some capacity.”
The graduates for the Class 24-2 are:
Tayler Shyenne Hamilton -Benson Police Department
Pedro Gonzalez Jr.- Bisbee Police Department
Mariah Long-Bisbee Police Department
Noa Bernal- Cochise County Sheriff’s Office
Joshua Darpino – Cochise County Sheriff’s Office
Luis Morales – Cochise County Sheriff’s Office
Jared Ratkovich – Cochise County Sheriff’s Office
Colton Sanders – Cochise County Sheriff’s Office
Jacob Sieler – Cochise County Sheriff’s Office
Juan Diego Chacon – Douglas Police Department
Ulysses Anthony Duronslet III – Douglas Police Department
Rafael Gonzalez Valdez – Douglas Police Department
Ramon Alexis Sosa – Douglas Police Department
Tyson Donaldson – Pima Police Department
Francisco Navarro Jr. – Santa Cruz County Sheriff’s Office
Jose Ramirez Jr. – Santa Cruz County Sheriff’s Office
Christopher Castañon – Sierra Vista Police Department
Brandon Leach – Sierra Vista Police Department
Triston Melton – Sierra Vista Police Department
Alexis Thompson -Sierra Vista Police Department
David Baldwin – Thatcher Police Department
“The SEALETA graduation celebrates a significant accomplishment in the lives of these new officers,” said Dr. Eric Brooks, executive director of the college’s First Responders Academy. “As they step into their role, they carry the responsibility of upholding peace and safeguarding the communities they serve. Their dedication and commitment to this profession is a reflection of their courage and resilience “

organizations.name: Southeast Arizona Law Enforcement Training Academy

author: JOSEPH NEWKIRK
title: United Mine Workers' 1919 strike paralyzed Quincy
text: During the 19 months of the United States’ involvement in World War I, the federal government froze industrial workers’ wages to finance its military effort. After the war ended on Nov. 11, 1918, the American economy boomed with massive exports for Europe’s rebuilding program. Workers in this country, though, did not receive pay raises, and in 1919 many unions across the country went on strike demanding more money and better working conditions. The government refused to intervene until the United Mine Workers (UMW) walked off the job on Nov. 1. Coal provided the vast majority of the country’s energy, and the United States considered mining an essential industry. This natural resource had fueled the Industrial Revolution; cries of “Bolshevik Revolution” and “Communism” echoed around the nation. This UMW strike greatly affected Illinois, where 77 of the state’s 102 counties engaged in coal mining and union membership totaled nearly 90,000. As part of the massive Colchester Seam (one of the world’s largest coal reserves) centered in Schuyler County, Quincy greatly suffered. Many homes and businesses went without sufficient heat and the economy here — and across the nation — spiraled toward depression, with dwindling coal supplies forcing rations and sacrifices.

author: Allure
title: 11 Best Powder Blushes Ever, According to Allure Editors | Nestia
text: Save this story Save Save this story Save All products are independently selected by our editors. If you buy something, we may earn an affiliate commission.We’re calling it: 2025 will be the year that the best powder blushes reign supreme. Unlike their denser sister formulations (as in, creams and liquids ), powder formulas feature buildable pigments and sheer textures that are a breeze to apply, making them more forgiving and beginner-friendly. Just like their creamier counterparts, powder blushes are available in a vast selection of minimal mattes, stunning shimmers, and everything in between, with the benefits of not looking or feeling greasy by mid-day—even if you skip setting powder . Now, enough rambling and more rouging—below, our editors (and a few makeup artists) chat all things powder blush, including application tips and favorite products.
